009package imagingbook.common.math.testing;
010
011import imagingbook.common.math.Matrix;
012import imagingbook.common.math.PrintPrecision;
013import imagingbook.common.math.eigen.Eigensolver2x2;
014
015/**
016 * This is a small demo program to show the use of the
017 * {@link Eigensolver2x2} class.
018 * It takes a 2x2 real-valued matrix and calculates its two
019 * eigenvalues and eigenvectors.
020 * Results are printed and checked.
021 * 
022 * @author WB
023 *@version 2020/03/25
024 */
025@Deprecated                     // move to tests!
026public class Eigensolver2x2Demo {
027        
028        public static void main(String[] args) {
029                
030                PrintPrecision.set(6);
031                
032                // specify a 2x2 matrix
033                double[][] M = {
034                                {3, -2},
035                                {-4, 1}};
036                
037                System.out.format("M =\n%s\n\n", Matrix.toString(M));
038                
039                Eigensolver2x2 solver = new Eigensolver2x2(M);
040                double[]   eigenvalues  = solver.getEigenvalues();
041                //double[][] eigenvectors = solver.getEigenvectors();
042                
043                System.out.println("eigenvalues/eigenvectors: check if M*x = \u03BB*x \n");
044                
045                for (int i = 1; i <= 2; i++) {
046                        // get the eigen-pair <lambda_i, x_i>
047                        double lambda = eigenvalues[i-1];
048                        double[] x = solver.getEigenvector(i-1);
049                        
050                        System.out.format("\u03BB_%d  = %.6f\n", i, lambda);
051                        System.out.format("x_%d = %s\n", i, Matrix.toString(x));
052                        
053                        System.out.format("Check: \u03BB_%d * x_%d = %s\n", i, i, Matrix.toString(Matrix.multiply(lambda, x)));
054                        System.out.format("Check:   M * x_%d = %s\n\n", i, Matrix.toString(Matrix.multiply(M, x)));
055                }
056
057        }
058}
059
060/*
061M =
062{{3.000000, -2.000000}, 
063{-4.000000, 1.000000}}
064
065eigenvalues/eigenvectors: check if M*x = λ*x 
066
067λ_1  = 5.000000
068x_1 = {4.000000, -4.000000}
069Check: λ_1 * x_1 = {20.000000, -20.000000}
070Check:   M * x_1 = {20.000000, -20.000000}
071
072λ_2  = -1.000000
073x_2 = {-2.000000, -4.000000}
074Check: λ_2 * x_2 = {2.000000, 4.000000}
075Check:   M * x_2 = {2.000000, 4.000000}
076*/
